## Description {#details}

Class to manage the bitcode writing for a module.

Definition at line 267 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/writer/bitcodewriter-cpp">BitcodeWriter.cpp</a>.

<SectionDefinition>

## Public Constructors

### pushValueAndType() {#a9c6c5649a416c7f7e9bdaec6746a5582}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>bool ModuleBitcodeWriter::pushValueAndType (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42; V, unsigned InstID, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl</a>&lt; unsigned &gt; &amp; Vals)</>}>
pushValueAndType - The file has to encode both the value and type id for many values, because we need to know what type to create for forward references.

However, most operands are not forward references, so this type field is not needed.

This function adds V&#39;s value <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a> to Vals. If the value <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a> is higher than the instruction <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>, then it is a forward reference, and it also includes the type <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a>. The value <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/callingconv/#abdf8cf606905c10634e831390981b0ed">ID</a> that is written is encoded relative to the InstID.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/writer/bitcodewriter-cpp/#l00400">400</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/bitcode/lib/bitcode/writer/bitcodewriter-cpp">BitcodeWriter.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void ModuleBitcodeWriter::writeValueSymbolTableForwardDecl ()">
Write a record that will eventually hold the word offset of the module-level VST.

For now the offset is 0, which will be backpatched after the real VST is written. Saves the bit offset to backpatch.
